Description of incident: JP Morgan Chase customers received a privacy notification in early September. A labeling error caused the Social Security numbers of customers to be printed on the outside of the notification letter.  A lawsuit was filed against JP Morgan Chase on behalf of affected customers.  The lawsuit claims that JP Morgan did not immediately notify its customers and should have prevented the breach from happening.  The case is Alexander Furman et al v JP Morgan Chase & Co et al, No. 13-cv-06749, U.S. District Court, Northern District of Illinois.
